data.title: Jeff Bezos sells Amazon stock worth $2.8 billion last week
data.text: Amazon.com Inc  Chief Executive Officer Jeff Bezos offloaded $990 million worth of shares in the company last Thursday and Friday, taking the total value of shares sold last week to $2.8 billion.

data.title: Amazon seeks FCC’s go-ahead to test mobile broadband devices in Silicon Valley
data.text: Amazon is seeking the Federal Communications Commission’s approval for a six-month test of mobile radio devices and networking software – but not at its Seattle home base.

data.title: Amazon's Jeff Bezos has sold roughly $2.8 billion worth of stock in the last week, filings show
data.text: Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos sold about $990 million worth of stock on Thursday and Friday, bringing total share sales to $2.8 billion over the past week.

data.title: Jeff Bezos has sold almost $3 billion in Amazon stock over the past week
data.text: Jeff Bezos has sold nearly $3 billion worth of Amazon.com Inc. stock in the past week, just as the shares have suffered their worst losing streak in 13 years.

data.title: 4 Top Stock Trades for Tuesday (Aug 6)
data.text: Amazon, Alphabet, Nio and Boeing were our top stock trades to watch on Monday, which was an ugly day on Wall Street.

data.title: Prime Day Was All About Amazon Growing Its Base
data.text: The biggest sellers were Amazon devices.

data.title: Is Amazon Stock a Perfect Storm or Perfect Opportunity?
data.text:
Amazon shares fell over 10% after earnings that were below analyst estimates, but it could bounce back quickly once the current selling pressure ebbs.
The post Is Amazon Stock a Perfect Storm or Perfect Opportunity?

data.title: Amazon stock suffers longest losing streak in 13 years
data.text: Shares of Amazon.com Inc. sank in afternoon trading Monday, putting them on track to suffer the longest losing streak in 13 years, as the triple threat of disappointing earnings, regulatory concerns and the broader stock-market selloff has weighed heavily on the e-commerce and cloud giant’s valuation.

data.title: Amazon Sends Users Dashing Toward Alexa
data.text: In 2015, when Amazon.com (NASDAQ: AMZN) introduced the Dash Button, I was skeptical of the premise behind the product. For anyone who doesn’t know, the button is a small Wi-Fi device that allows customers to place an order for a specific product.

data.title: Alexa allows users to disable human review of voice recordings
data.text: Company is not following Apple and Google in suspending practice altogether.

data.title: Monday’s Vital Data: Apple, Amazon and Twitter
data.text: Options trading was buzzing in Apple, Amazon, and Twitter Friday. Here are the metrics that matter moving forward.

data.title: Amazon Sacrifices For Long-Term Growth
data.text: Amazon dropped 3% from Tuesday to Friday to $1,943 per share on disappointing results.

data.title: Expert says buy the Amazon dip despite longest losing streak since January 2016
data.text: Here's why one market watcher says FANG stocks are still worth buying.

data.title: Amazon's stock falls toward longest losing streak in 13 years
data.text: Shares of Amazon.com Inc. AMZN, -1.73% sank 2.5% in premarket trading Monday, which puts them on track to suffer an 8th-straight loss, which would be the longest losing streak in 13 years.

data.title: Challenges Ahead Might Slow Amazon, Not Derail Its Ascension
data.text: Amazon delivered a mixed bag for the Q2 2019 earnings report.
